body_html:
I ran into the same error "marked as not fetchable" at tf.cond(predicate, lambda: op, lambda: tf.no_op()). I got it around by setting the identity for the opp after tf.cond()

tf.identity(self.object_inside_op, name="boxes")
body_text:
I ran into the same error "marked as not fetchable" at tf.cond(predicate, lambda: op, lambda: tf.no_op()). I got it around by setting the identity for the opp after  tf.cond()
tf.identity(self.object_inside_op, name="boxes")
body:
I ran into the same error "marked as not fetchable" at tf.cond(predicate, lambda: op, lambda: tf.no_op()). I got it around by setting the identity for the opp after  tf.cond()

`tf.identity(self.object_inside_op, name="boxes")`
